00018 // set EAX to smth, return to smth
00019 template<typename T>
00020 class retfunc {
00021 protected:
00022         REGISTERS *R;
00023         DWORD retAddr;
00024 public:
00025         retfunc(REGISTERS *r, DWORD addr) : R(r), retAddr(addr) {};
00026         int operator()( T Result ) {
00027                 R->set_EAX((DWORD)Result);
00028                 return retAddr;
00029         }
00030 };
00031 
00032 // set EAX to smth, return to fixed
00033 template<typename T>
00034 class retfunc_fixed : public retfunc<T> {
00035 protected:
00036         T Result;
00037 public:
00038         retfunc_fixed(REGISTERS *r, DWORD addr, T res) : retfunc(r, addr), Result(res) {};
00039         int operator()() {
00040                 R->set_EAX((DWORD)Result);
00041                 return retAddr;
00042         }
00043 };
00044 
00045 // return to one of two fixed
00046 class retfunc_bool : public retfunc<int> {
00047 protected:
00048         DWORD negAddr;
00049 public:
00050         retfunc_bool(REGISTERS *r, DWORD yAddr, DWORD nAddr) : retfunc(r, yAddr), negAddr(nAddr) {};
00051         int operator()(bool choose) {
00052                 return choose ? retAddr : negAddr;
00053         }
00054 };

00056 // invalid pointers
00057 
00058 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00059 void AnnounceInvalidPointerMap(stdext::hash_map<T1, T2> &map, void *ptr) {
00060         stdext::hash_map<T1, T2>::iterator i = map.find(reinterpret_cast<T1>(ptr));
00061         if(i != map.end()) {
00062                 map.erase(i);
00063         }
00064 
00065         for(i = map.begin(); i != map.end(); ++i) {
00066                 if(ptr == ((void *)(i->second))) {
00067                         map.erase(i->first);
00068                 }
00069         }
00070 }
00071 
00072 template<typename T1>
00073 void AnnounceInvalidPointer(T1 elem, void *ptr) {
00074         if(ptr == (void *)elem) {
00075                 elem = NULL;
00076         }
00077 }

00090 class CellSpreadIterator {
00091 protected:
00092         CellStruct *origin;
00093         DWORD radius;
00094         DWORD position;
00095         CellSpreadApplicator callback;
00096         
00097         public:
00098                 CellSpreadIterator(CellSpreadApplicator &_callback, CellStruct *_origin, DWORD _radius) 
00099                         : callback(_callback), origin(_origin), radius(_radius), position(0)
00100                         { }
00101 
00102                 void Apply() {
00103                         DWORD countCells = CellSpread::NumCells(radius);
00104 
00105                         for(; position < countCells; ++position) {
00106                                 CellStruct tmpCell = CellSpread::GetCell(position);
00107                                 tmpCell += *origin;
00108                                 if(MapClass::Global()->CellExists(&tmpCell)) {
00109                                         CellClass *c = MapClass::Global()->GetCellAt(&tmpCell);
00110                                         for(ObjectClass *curObj = c->GetContent(); curObj; curObj = curObj->NextObject) {
00111                                                 callback(curObj, origin);
00112                                         }
00113                                 }
00114                         }
00115                 }
00116 
00117 };

00131 class CellSequence {
00132         XY sta;
00133         XY end;
00134 
00135 public:
00136         CellSequence(CoordStruct *From, CoordStruct *To)
00137          : sta(From), end(To)
00138         {
00139         }
00140 
00141         void Apply(CellSequenceApplicator& Callback) {
00142                 Trajectory T(sta.X, sta.Y, end.X, end.Y);
00143 
00144                 Trajectory::vec allCells;
00145 
00146                 T.path(allCells);
00147 
00148                 for(Trajectory::vec::iterator i = allCells.begin(); i != allCells.end(); ++i) {
00149                         CellClass *Cell = MapClass::Instance->GetCellAt(&*i);
00150                         Callback(Cell);
00151                 }
00152         }
00153 };

00155 // vroom vroom
00156 // Westwood uses if(((1 << HouseClass::ArrayIndex) & TechnoClass::DisplayProductionToHouses) != 0) and other bitfields like this (esp. in CellClass, omg optimized). helper wrapper just because
00157 template <typename T>
00158 class IndexBitfield {
00159         DWORD data;
00160         public:
00161         IndexBitfield(const DWORD defVal = 0) : data(defVal) {};
00162 
00163         bool Contains(const T obj) {
00164                 return (this->data & (1 << obj->ArrayIndex)) != 0;
00165         }
00166         void Add(const T obj) {
00167                 this->data |= (1 << obj->ArrayIndex);
00168         }
00169         void Remove(const T obj) {
00170                 this->data &= ~(1 << obj->ArrayIndex);
00171         }
00172 };
